Topic.Title: Univision does the job liberal media won't

Message.Msg: One might first ask why anyone should pay any attention to some clown who needs to use copycat aliases on a message board? How valid is anything that you have to say if you must resort to trying to fool people into thinking you’re someone else? Do you honestly believe that anyone takes such juvenile behavior seriously? “Their left-wing bias has become all too apparent. Indeed, a new Gallup Poll shows Americans now distrust the mainstream media.” – fake Ricky with the “L” not 1. No, the poll doesn’t say any such thing. The poll discusses media – not “Main Stream Media” – There is no such thing, other than in the cluttered minds of folks unconcerned with factual information. “Republicans continue to express the least trust in the media, while Democrats express the most. Percent who express a great deal or fair amount of trust in the media: Democrats = 58% Republicans = 26% Well, no sh#t Sherlock! I wouldn’t trust them too much either if all I watched was Fox, Limbaugh, or Glen Beck.

Topic.Title: losing customers

Message.Msg: If lost market share represents high cost causing customers, that is not such a bad thing.

Message.Title: The Quote of the Decade:
Message.Msg: The Quote of the Decade: "The fact that we are here today to debate raising America 's debt limit is a sign of leadership failure. It is a sign that the US Government cannot pay its own bills. It is a sign that we now depend on ongoing financial assistance from foreign countries to finance our Government's reckless fiscal policies. Increasing America 's debt weakens us domestically and internationally. Leadership means that, "the buck stops here.' Instead, Washington is shifting the burden of bad choices today onto the backs of our children and grandchildren. America has a debt problem and a failure of leadership. Americans deserve better." ~ Senator Barack H. Obama, March 2006 Pass it on 'til eternity...or at least until he is defeated.

Topic.Title: Univision does the job liberal media won't

Message.Msg: “Republicans continue to express the least trust in the media, while Democrats express the most." And you have to wonder why? It is not Fox News that won't print anything real about Obama. It is not Fox News that will not ask pointed questions of Obama, Harry, or Nancy, it is only the network media that refuses to do. Why are the media asking for 'detailed' economic recovery plans from Romney when they don't ask the same question of Obama? We are the American media not asking hard questions about who knew what and when about Fast and Furious or Arab Spring or Libya? Why do they always just assume that the Democrats are telling the truth, the full truth, not just selected portions but just the opposite with anyone else? Why do they not care more about the truth, the full truth than ratings? Of course you will not answer these questions, first because you can’t, second because it wouldn’t fit with your political philosophy and political naivety. Nice to hear another side, although you’re side is always the same old list of Democratic talking points. You must watch a ton of TV to have such a wide understanding of what Fox and the rest of the media really do. You’re a sound bite baby.

Topic.Title: Does Barry Believe in God?

Message.Msg: Why should anyone else help his brother if he won't? Why doesn't he want to give his brother the 'opportunity' that he wants to give all the 'Dreamers'? Could it be because his brother can't vote for him? Could it be that any mention of his brother and his plight would be an immediate political embarrassment for Obama? Nah, none of that could matter to such a compassionate, understanding and caring person, could it? Heck, this guy even threw Grandma under the bus after she raised him.

Topic.Title: Obama appologizes to Mooslums but not Christians

Message.Msg: Mostly because he doesn't have to afraid that Christians in the US will rise up and burn someone's embassy or kill protestors. The big difference is that religion in most countries is a personal belief system, not a quasi government that wants to be the entire government. We do not believe in or accept killing people because we are offended. Contrary to what many believe and our courts are beginning share, there is no Constitutional right to NOT BE OFFENDED. Be offended if you must, but the government does not have the power and should not act as if they have the power to protect you from never being offended. Our President believes that Is lam should be protected.

Topic.Title: Obama appologizes to Mooslums but not Christians

Message.Msg: The word begins with an “M” and it ends with an “n” and it has a couple of “o’s” in it. Vanna wants to know if you’d like to buy an “r”? So, that word is not permitted on Yahoo’s message board, even though when you search for it, there are countless references going back 10 years. Who’s running the yahoo cops – Ernest Angley? Let’s see how many of these synonyms get by these crack guardians of virtue: Synonyms airhead, birdbrain, blockhead, bonehead, bubblehead, chowderhead, chucklehead, clodpoll (or clodpole), clot [British], cluck, clunk, cretin, cuddy (or cuddie) [British dialect], deadhead, dim bulb [slang], dimwit, dip, dodo, dolt, donkey, doofus [slang], dope, dork [slang], dullard, dumbbell, dumbhead, dum-dum, dummkopf, dummy, dunce, dunderhead, fathead, gander, golem, goof, goon, half-wit, hammerhead, hardhead, ignoramus, imbecile, jackass, know-nothing, knucklehead, lamebrain, loggerhead [chiefly dialect], loon, lump, lunkhead, meathead, mome [archaic], #$%$ mug [chiefly British], mutt, natural, nimrod [slang], nincompoop, ninny, ninnyhammer, nit [chiefly British], nitwit, noddy, noodle, numskull (or numbskull), oaf, pinhead, prat [British], ratbag [chiefly Australian], saphead, schlub (also shlub) [slang], schnook [slang], simpleton, stock, stupe, stupid, thickhead, turkey, woodenhead, yahoo, yo-yo
